intro: Myosotis intermedia var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked forget-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers with five petals, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valued species in both horticulture and ecological restoration projects.
